intro: Rechsteineria lineata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf rechsteineria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
